reviewText:
I really admire Peter Florek's gambit in this show.  He suspects that Will Gardner is as morally bankrupt as he is.  He is setting up a prosecution of Will for some very dicey dealings he had with  judges and gambling. But I suspect he is doing it to show that Will has no more loyalty to Alicia than he did. He suspects, as do I, that Will Will dump Alicia in order to save himself. And what I expect to see happen is for Alicia to runright over to Michael J. Fox's law firm and take him up on his job offer from last season. And that will upset everyone's apple cart in this show.

I am equally fascinated by Peter's mother, who seems to be living in a time warp.  She snoops through Alicia's things,including her computer, to get evidence to use against her to get sole custody for Peter. Peter is surely unaware of this as the last thing he wants is a controversial child custody hearing airing their further dirty laundry. Eli, in fact, would hit the ceiling if he learned of it. The reason Jackie is living in a time warp is challenging the custody of two teenagers, one close to college age, borders on the laughable. Jackie is living back in the fifties or sixties and Eli has already warned her about that.

Special mention must be made of Christine Baranski as the other senior law partner.  She is doing a knockout job in her role as Diane Lockheart.

The case itself is pretty interesting this time.  In order to help one client accused of murder, she has to try to get a stay of execution for a well deserving inmate whose execution date looms. This was extremely refreshing in that the writers did not try to sugarcoat the realities of the con on death row.  He is a repulsive human being.  Nevertheless his mother is willing to get on the stand and call herself a lousy parent just to get him a stay.  The local priest is willing to do the same since he is opposed to his being executed. And our scenes with him only makes us wish he were being strapped down NOW!  This is very rare with death penalty portrayals either in movies or tv. So bravo to GOOD WIFE.

Meanwhile, conflicts on the home-office front complicate everyone's lives. Diane is extremely suspicious about Alicia and Will. Jackie, Peter's mother, is intent on causing trouble, as usual. She has to be the blindest parent in Chicago since all she ever sees are Alicia's flaws and never Peter's. The kids themselves are three years older and no longer dewy eyed about their parents, although their parents fall to notice this.  You can now see the young adults they will become. And Eli remains Eli, doing his thing, and thus one of my favorite characters. The conflict between the firm detective and Alicia seems to be on the back burner for awhile. Frankly, I think they should both conclude that Peter is not worth a second more of anyone's conflict with anyone else.

The most interesting development to my mind was well developed in this episode.  This is that Will Gardner may be every bit as bad a choice for romantic interest as Peter Florek proved to be.  Most series tv would have never let Alicia and Will start having an affair.  That's because the creators would be thinking in terms of "happy ever after" which is synonymous with the "the end" in series tv. Not so here.  This is a series willing to take risks.

We learn, for example, that Will once embezzled from a client's account to cover his gambling debts. Then, in one case against the government, which Alicia is trying with Diane, Alicia is put in a precarious position with the government.  When she consults with Will and Diane about it, her concern grows that they are more interested in protecting the firm than in protecting her.

There is a high bit of comedy here too if you have been watching all seasons.  The two most shark like lawyers have been Michael J. Fox's character and Carey's friend who became a house husband. These two make terrific long term husbands and fathers.  Will and Peter are considerably less talented as lawyers and they both make rotten husbands and father material. They can't leave their viciousness and game on the playing field of the courtroom. Alicia is thus a flawed heroine too as she is solely attracted to the wrong men as husbands and father material.

I love this show so the only thing I am viewing with some dismay is that they seem to be taking on Cuddy from the HOUSE MD show.  Lisa Edelstein, the actress, plays an attorney who is a thousand times more annoying than Cuddy, the hospital administrator and doctor from HOUSE.  And, of all things, she is a former love interest of Will Gardener's!

Other than that, the show is great though.  Alicia has a murder case this time out.  There is a lot of tension in the firm over just about everything.  Eli is insisting on getting more and more assistance and since he is paying the firm big, he is a hard guy to deny. Diane thinks the firm needs to bring in a bankruptcy division because of the economy.  It is the one specialty that does extremely well in bad times.

Although the rift between the two women still hasn't been smoothed, I personally think we are getting set up for a much bigger rift to open up between Alicia and the firm through her current involvement with Will. And when that explodes, she also must still contend with her vendetta seeking husband and his new henchman, Carey. Actually, Alicia would probably do a lot better with her career if she worked for the Michael J. Fox character or for Eli since these are men who do not interest her romantically nor are they interested in her romantically.

I will be staying tuned each week.

Starting into season three. I keep watching this show in the hopes that something will happen. They keep dragging the same story-line out. Alicia keeps winning cases in a ludicrous way, at the last minute. Calinda keeps finding things very easily that the police overlook. There is no such thing as conflict of interest at this law firm - this very large firm that seems to only have 4 lawyers work on cases - the partners, the divorce attorney, and Alicia (allegedly still just a 3rd year associate, but an expert on every type of law!). I'm also still trying to figure out how Alicia thinks she can keep her separation and her affair from anyone, when she and Peter seem to be incredibly well known. I very much enjoy the Eli character but I'm pretty sure he will grow tiresome as he has now joined the firm.
Great show!

This series is a fascinating display of the moral turpitudes of licensed professional liars.  It is especially interesting in that it focuses on Al Capone's hometown Chicago and connects to many quite modern felonious abrogators of the human and civil rights of American citizens including the illegally seizing of the property of American citizens, in violation of Article IV of the US Constitution Amendments, "Treasury" Department which pretends that its own feloniously slopperated "computer" systems are to be the exclusive record of their debt drunk squandrous wastrel debts.  At one point it mentions that anyone interviewing a licensed professional liar can typically discover *which* felonies induced that "lawyer" to become one, something which I had long since recognized. It is an engaging, well photographed, acted, directed, and produced television series.

The first several episodes were silly and disappointing. The only attention to the much anticipated love affair was over the scandal and not the romance. The lead characters have so much chemistry, they deserved more onscreen time alone together. Then the subplots with Eli Stone, at least in the beginning, seem to provide fluff, comic relief, instead of substance. But it's not all bad; and the season definitely improves by episode 7. In this show, I love how the characters play off each other's personalities, and how the cases provide so many questions of right and wrong and in between. So much to wrestle with--in a safe, fictional way--providing questions and issues that can linger in the real world.

The series had some outrageous situation, totally unbelievable, like a state attorney, sleeping with a prostitute ( and the video gone viral) gets re-elected as the state attorney. By the third season, I ended up hating every character. I wish I can sensor the TV program so that I can only watch the court room scenes.

Wow, really good!  I don't want to give any spoilers, but I'll describe as best I can.  They are really keeping it fresh this season and there's A LOT going on.  There's all kinds of "happenings" with Peter, Alicia, and Will.  The mother in law Jackie is even more of a "pain in the buns".  There's a great line where Eli tells her, "calm down Jackie, it's not the 50's".  I love that guy and they are keeping him busy too.

In the 1st season, I didn't care for Cary Agos.  By the end of the second season, he started to grow on me.  During this season, they really evolve his character...and it's a great story to watch.

Other notable highlights:  one episode has a return to military court...and it's so good!  It's interesting and funny, but also very heartfelt about the case itself and the outcome.  Another interesting episode is about bitcoin, the digital currency...or is it a commodity?  (Legal joke - ha!).

The only reason for 4 stars vs. 5 stars is there seems to be a few too many new characters to keep track of.  I often found myself thinking - "Where did they come from?  Do I need to pay attention to them...?

The last episode is an absolute cliffhanger !!!  Happy watching !!!

The Good Wife is a much acclaimed TV series, and does have a number of interesting characters- Kalinda probably being the most provocative. However, as one continues to watch the show. the story line becomes both tedious and a bit unbelievable. The courtroom "drama" is just that- drama. It has absolutely no connection to reality. I know that these types of shows--doctors, lawyers, firemen-- are often far from accurate, but the good Wife does border on the ridiculous. The law firm politics are also quite overblown. I do like many of the characters, but they seem to transform into caricatures as the seasons pass. The series does hold one's attention, as we always want to see "what happens next", but it is a flawed experience.

I'm a big fan of 24 and The Good Wife. That's because both of these shows have top writers and producers. I like character driven fiction and there are enough characters in both these shows to make me watch the same shows over and over. Chloe & Kalinda are two of the most well-developed, weirdoes ever to fascinate me. It takes real genius to balance character and plot without distorting the fabric of the whole show. The GW crew does it show after show. What is so good about this show, is that there is seldom a shooting, or a car chase and the characters are almost never naked or engaged in ridiculous, hyper sex. The characters in this show are smart, sexy, well-educated, and complex. Pretty much the same description as the characters in 24. One show gave me Nina Myers; the other gave me Richard Lee. Thanks to 24 and TGW, the genera of TV is not all talking heads and air-balls; instead, it is, sometimes, art.

This show was amazing from the very first episode and season 3 continues that trend. To me, the big message of season 3 was that every action has consequences no matter how big or small, personal or professional, truth or lie. You see that with pretty much every character in a multitude of ways. I really like the scenes with the siblings like the ones between Alicia and Owen or Will and his sisters because you're able to see glimpses into the characters that you wouldn't see otherwise. I would've liked to have seen more with Alicia and Will and the relationship but I feel that's like true life too because you don't always get the closure you need even if you see that person every day. As much as it pains me to say it since I really like Alicia and Will, I think season 3 gave Alicia time to grow a bit professionally without her being always an extension of Will. And I think she needed that as a career woman. Although that scene at the end when they're counting down midnight to mark his suspension being over, you see him drinking and clinking glasses with Diane, which was a great scene and I loved how she stood up to everyone and went to bat for Will this season and even how she stood up to the others for Alicia this season, and Alicia standing outside in the empty offices holding what looks like champagne with ribbons. She's watching them having drinks and it's sad, sad because she doesn't walk in there, she just drops the bottle on table and leaves and sad that if it would've been season 1, she would've been the one he was drinking with. I can't wait to see how the actions and consequences shake themselves out in season 4.

I kept hearing this show was excellent - so I was happy to see it come to Amazon Prime from Season 1.  This show is entirely different than I expected, and really quite good.  Interesting courtroom cases which always makes for a good show, but even better is the cast of characters who have all been fleshed out with complexity.  This show also does a great job of introducing secondary characters - such as judges and opposing council - and bringing them back again and again which not only seems realistic, but also really adds to the entire world built by this show.  The Good Wife gets almost everything right - sometimes shows like this build a lot of great supporting cast members but the actual main character is my least favorite (I'm looking at you "How I Met Your Mother" and "Gray's Anatomy") but here Alicia Florrick has a fairly unimpeachable moral center, she really is "The Good Wife" while also being very well rounded, totally sympathetic and completely likable.  Her kids are also likable and still realistic. And really, the whole series is worth watching just for Elsbeth Tascioni who should get a spinoff.

This isn't the type of television moment like the Sopranos or Breaking Bad - instead it is comfort food television that goes down very easy but you are happy to find that it has a lot more nutritional value than these types of shows usually do.

I grind my teeth whenever I hear Michael J. Fox saying that he has Tardive Dyskinesia. This is not a disease in and of itself, It is caused by side effects from some anti-psychotic drugs, and is not reversible, neither is it deadly. Michael has none of the facial contortions of Tardive Dyskinesia. He does have Parkinson's,  I have seen people suffering PD, I do not note any of the classics of PD symptom unless the tablets he is taking for PD caused Tardive Dyskineasia. and it is not a very convincing show of it. It is very confusing for the non-lay person and unauthentic. Does he limp or shuffle? Does he pill role or has any new medication come on the market to help with some of his PD symptoms. He makes some remarks that are very inaccurate regarding his disease process. It would be more feasible if the writers would get it right. Although I liked him as an actor before, I do  not like his role as Louis Canning on "The Good Wife". The rest of it is great.

So as I'm writing this we are a few episodes into Season 4 and things are getting interesting. This series seems to be another example of how a series sometimes needs to find its legs. The first couple of seasons were uneven and seemed to be on the verge of becoming just another lawyer show. But Season 3 delved into what has come to be the major theme throughout, paranoia. The absolute self interest first attitude of all of the characters, including the Good Wife, has made this a study of all of the values that Americans hold dear. We're liking it a good deal.

Solid writing, but the main protagonist (Alicia) is just too hard to relate to at times.  Introducing her mother's character helps the viewer understand the tumultuous background from which she emerged, and sheds light on some of her stupid emotional decisions, but the writing is otherwise some of the best that exists for television.  Makes sense that Ridley Scott is a major influence.  Most of his writing is fairly complex, even if not highly refined.  Still far superior to the majority of producers.

From season 1 until now, my wife and I have been mesmerized, often bingeing on three episodes at a time. It all begins with the writing: sharp, layered, nuanced, surprising, and adult. The characters are flawed, quirky, original, and mostly likable (with one exception: Nick). Casting is superb. From the core cast to the guest star visitors, they are just right. Even the various judges are far more than predictable stick figures. On to direction. As front stories and back stories co-exist, the directors keep the pace so involving that one hardly dares blink, let alone drift away for a beer. Television simply doesn't get any better than The Good Wife. Fasten your seat belts.

However, it is clear that,the writer have a liberal agenda when they had an episode that addressed their opinions regarding the case in Indiana of a Christian baker who refused to bake a wedding cake for a lesbian wedding. I, as a CHristian, grow very weary of the LGBT agenda being shoved down my throat through every TV show I like when only a small percentage of our population is LGBT. No other section of our population gets the attention of the media that this group does, and frankly, there are other much more worthy injustices going on in our nation such as human trafficking that we should be crying from the rooftops about than a person's sexual preference.

Several cases Lockhart Gardner worked on were really intriguing, like the British case, the death row case, the military case, and many others. Plus, this season featured a lot more of my favorite villain, Louis Canning. Then there were all the inter-office politics at Lockhart Gardner as well as the giant case the state's attorney's office spent half the season working on (if you've seen season 3, you know what I'm talking about.) I'm hoping season 4 can top this one!

The Good Wife is one of my all time favorite shows.  It rarely has wild crazy scenes, but it does have lots of twists and turns that I find riveting.  And the court cases are often, not always, very interesting.  Alicia, the main character, is wonderful and is developing over the seasons:  usually even keeled but every now and then, she sticks it to someone in the courtroom or even better, outside, and you cheer!  Passionate Eli Gold is always good for a tantrum or two:  love that character!  And Jackie, the mother-in-law, is so consistently infuriating that you gotta love her too.  Even the kids are well developed characters with 2 very good actors.  Kalinda Sharma is definitely complex, hidden, and just plain scary because she is fierce and willing to do pretty much anything to get the job done.  Chris Noth as "the bad husband" Peter, is always good to look at and is a true politician who is a true fighter who deeply loves his family.  Most of the characters are so deeply flawed in so many ways, but almost all of them make me root for them at some point, and for me, that makes for a great show!

I love this series. It gives a different perspective on the legal system. We get to see more than just the legal back-and-forth between prosecution and defense; we get to see how home life affects legal life and more.

I don't know how many families there are where husband and wife are on opposite sides of the legal fence. I would imagine that most people who read these reviews already know that Alicia Florrick is a defense lawyer while her husband is State District Attorney for Chicago (Cook County). I saw most of these episodes when they were first run, and I'm thoroughly enjoying watching these the second time around.

I highly recommend every season of The Good Wife.

This is one of the best shows ever to hit the airways! It's about a group of high profile attorneys, but the main focus is on a States Attorney and his wife. He is caught in a sex scandal that forces his wife to question her commitment to their marriage. They have two teenage children, who's also inadvertenly caught up in the drama of this. Also, two mother-in laws who grace us with their presence. One, who is quite nosey and competative with the States Attorney's wife, and the other who is completely carefree, but has outrageous notions and antics about how children should be raised. Neither of which the teenagers mother approves of but puts up with. In addition, it's about a high profile law firm called Lockhart/Gardner, the firm where the States Attorney's wife work. And how her life is intertwined with different individuals who also work for this firm, including how she becomes involved with one of the partners. All this among cases that Lockhart/Gardner must bring to trial. Juicy stuff. I highly recommend this show to anyone!

Fascinating, finely-drawn characters, conflict that resonates in personal and professional life, insight into the complexities of the legal arena. My special treat at the end of a long day: curl up on the couch and watch an "Alicia".
I'm into the third season and only become more amazed at Julianna Margulies portrayal of a wronged wife as she makes, daily, hourly decisions about her future, her family and her place in a world she had only skirted for the previous 13 years. Nothing is as simple and clear-cut as it might seem when you are on the outside, looking in. I think that by the end of the series (and I hope that is not for a long time to come!), Alicia will have gained a great deal of insight into her husband's downfall, and see how close she has come to walking the same path.

I never expected to like this show. I watched the first episode of season one because it is free for Prime members and I was bored and needed something to fill the time one evening...and that was all it took. I am hooked now. In fact I have a hard time imagining what my TV viewing life will be like after I've seen all the episodes in all the seasons. I guess it's still running on CBS and might last for many more years, but I'm not good with commercial interruptions (or even fast-forwarding through the breaks).

The acting is good enough. Not great but very competent. The writing per each episode is well above average. I think what does it for me are the way the overall story arcs are developed and the way the characters have evolved (within each episode and over multiple seasons). I care about these people and I'm interested to see what happens to them.

Seasons 1 and 2 were much stronger, story-wise. Season 3 is still top-notch with excellent performances and overall story-arcs, but for my money, the episode by episode legal cases, and the personal encounters they contained, were less satisfying overall than I felt from Seasons 1 and 2. I say this from having started by watching Season 6. Then backtracking to all of Season 5, both of which have been just solid and outstanding... And they prompted me to go all the way back to the start, and watch from the beginning. So, in a crazy way, I am experiencing the series with more context than even the writers/showrunners had when Season 3 was airing, and thus surely when they were writing it. I was glad to be done with the two competing detectives of Season 2.... but that got replaced by other season-conflict-agents. I am really being nit-picky here, and I have not delved far into Season 4 yet... just 3 episodes into it right now, and so I'm not sure whether I will feel the same awe I felt from Season 1 and Season 2.

Having said all this, Season 3 continued with the show's trademark features including quirky but real personalities of the various judges in courtrooms and their impacts on proceedings, and with the whole depiction of internet video posts going viral and how they impact political campaigns, religious and non-religious beliefs and the very unusual for network-TV central character of Alicia being unapologetically a non-religious person, and the interesting current day phenomena that the writers weave into their stories such as Bitcoin the new digital currency. Lots to learn from the Good Wife...

Still intensely enjoying this wonderful show - the only one I know that portrays a truly mature woman!
I mean, youve seen on TV more than a few silly babes with too much exposed skin, and bitchy older
women who are so neurotically-disabled their husbands cheating with babes seems almost justified.
Finally, here we have a female lead whos quite smart and great-on-her-feet in the marvelous headlines-
relavent courtroom scenes. Yet as signaled by the series title, the background story arc shows us how
she adjusts privately and publicly (hes a public figure, also in the law) to her husbands betrayal. Though
well-controlled, you can see on her face how her feelings subtly appear, how shes subject to her attractions,
fears, friendships and even lust, while remaining grounded in her values of tolerance and loyalty,
 including her no-longer-fashionable respect for her marriage vows, the family welfare of her two
deeply-loved children and her jockying position in her evolving law firm. This series remains a delight,
and deserves all its awards!

The Good Wife, all 5 seasons that I have seen so far, is possibly the best courtroom drama series I have seen, "Law and Order" included.  There are many believable twists and turns; a wide variety of actors, many of whom we haven't seen in quite a while, and the story line is excellent. I admit that I binge-watched it like I did "Breaking Bad."  You just can't get away from it.  The chemistry - both negative and positive - between the actors makes you believe you are the proverbial "fly on the wall", watching things unfold on both sides of the aisle, and watching as the opposing law offices concoct their strategies for a wide variety of criminal and civil cases.  Start with Season 1; Episode 1, and watch as things unfold through the entire series.  Not many series on TV can touch it.

I love the show. It is well-written, well-acted and not just a little bit addictive. My wife and I are binge-watching and consume at least three episodes each evening.

One of my favorite parts of the show is to see who will fill the roster of guest characters with each new episode. It's a treasure trove of cast members from shows like The Sopranos, ER, Law & Order, etc. It seems the longer the show runs, the better the list of guest stars gets.

However, I do tire of the Will/Alicia on-again, off-again romance story line. For a while it seemed they carried on the same conversation in every episode.

They find themselves in a compromising position (usually self-induced); there is some romantic gesture or overture (or at least palpable sexual tension) followed by one or the other (usually Will) saying, "We need to talk." It gets old. Hopefully, the story line will change in season five, which is where we are in our binge-watching saga.

Other than that, I really enjoy the show.

This is not your "typical" law show.  The Good Wife is an extremely well-written drama that involves complex characters whose real lives unfold around the business operations of a law firm.  Viewers are ushered into a world of litigation, arbitration, grand juries and the like, gaining a greater understanding of our judicial system, while also looking into the individual lives of the characters being played out....the moral and emotional challenges they face.

The acting is superb.  The regular cast is made up of seasoned actors and special appearances by the likes of Michael J. Fox and Rita Wilson, to name a few, are added bonuses.  Each episode stands alone in content, but has much greater depth when viewed as a total season.
I love watching this while doing cardio at the gym. Just the right amount of time and I can catch up on what I missed in the series.

I'm late to have discovered The Good Wife.... but I've been binge-watching it for weeks from the very first season..... I'm in Season 4 now.. and just the thought of not being able to watch more of this show is knocking me out... this show is compelling from the beginning of each episode until the end, the writing is impeccable, the cast is amazing and each character is a full blown major contender.... There must be a way to get Calista a show of her own.  If someone is not doing this they need to... but the writers must be the same for the best results.  I never get tired of Alicia - even when she is being her worst own enemy...and I adore Diane.  The clothes... did I talk about the clothes?  Holy gorgeousness!  Cary is perfect (His dad is a mess 'o bedbugs) Mr. Florrick (what can I say Chris Noth is terrific not just because he's nice to look at)  Story lines are meticulously drawn.... I love every minute of this show.  Ha!  I'm babbling about it!

As I have said in my reviews of the first and second seasons, this series is addicting. It is well written, well acted, and well directed. This show hit the road running and has not stopped. I am very glad to be able to catch up this summer on Amazon Prime.

all the characters are sketched out very well.
There is drama in the series but the subtle kind, where just a twitch in the facial muscle is enough to tell you what the character is going through. No need for loud noises, cries tears etc. Specially Alicia , she is the one who is wronged, is plagued by her own guilt to even retaliate. Yet she holds her own so beautifully. I love how she manages her professional life, her teenage kids and her mother in law. I could never be so firm and calm in the face of provocation like she is. And I just try to live her life on screen for just a little bit.

I had noticed this series for years was on TV but for some reason the title just did not grab me enough for me to ever watch or even record it.  I recently purchased a Kindle Fire HDX and saw all past seasons were available on my Prime Video so decided to take a chance. My first surprise was how drawn I became to the characters and the many concurrent plots and relationships.  Terrific acting by all and once I began watching the first season I was hooked.  Watched all currently available seasons almost non stop.  Just turned my TV off.  My next surprise was how much more I enjoyed watching on my Kindle Fire HDX than my recently purchased Samsung Smart LED TV.  The crispness of the picture on the Kindle Fire HDX I found to be almost like viewing professional photographs..it was so good.  When I purchased the Kindle I was conflicted about whether I would enjoy watching anything on such a small screen but the picture quality and the portability makes my Kindle the go to source for video now.  "In my opinion" :-), you will love these presentations.

The characters the actors portray are excellent. They bring reality to the political and judicial system. My husband and I love watching this program and will be disappointed when it ends.
Acting superb...just a couple of the story lines a little difficult to follow but overall we really enjoy this excellent series.
Very well acting. The story lines are from what is going on in the world today.  I really enjoy watching this series.
Awesome show! The characters are as smart as they should be for corporate lawyers yet as human as we all are. They have such realistic reactions to situations they encounter.

The Good Wife is always interesting, beginning to end. I recently started watching from episode one. The acting is top notch and the back story is as interesting as the featured story. I am not a huge fan of dramas, but I give this one five stars.

I have become addicted to The Good Wife.  I've watched episodes from current seasons from time to time, but I couldn't get into it.  Then I discovered that it was on Amazon Prime and I could start in the first season.  I have gotten into the story that continues from episode to episode and season to season.  It is a little like a soap opera at times, but I like it anyway.  I love reading mysteries and I like dramas about detectives and/or attorneys.  I liked Perry Mason when I was a teenager.  I liked the Colombo series.  I love reading Louise Penny mysteries on my Kindle.  So if that is the kind of story that you like, you will love this series.

I love the law cases and the investigation and now I am stuck on who might end up with who.....
Romance intrigue and law stuff..
Every season it gets better and better I can binge on this show for hours. I'm hope they make it to double digit seasons
Omg I love this show I can't wait to be able to see season 5 too bad I have to pay for it ;( but soooo with it !!

I really enjoy this show. Each episode keeps me guessing. Great characters.

I highly recommend watching this show - it's addictive!!

It's getting a little racier and a little more violent. The characters are fascinating, believable and consistent. By this season I am so invested in their personalities and storylines, I am hooked. Excellent actors. I love that even with all the angst and drama, there is a good amount of laugh out loud humor!
Great show!! Great cast!! I like the reacurring characters and that at times humorous! You will love The Good Wife!

What more can I say.  The ensemble cast is brilliant.  You love some, admire some, and hate some.  The stories are always gripping; sometimes pushing the envelope but so enjoyable.  When does season 5 go to Prime?
Watch it from the beginning of Season One so you understand the story line and the characters evolution. Great program!
My husband and I thoroughly enjoy this show and it's terrific not to have any commercials! The downloading is still show, but worth the trouble.
Addicting show -- currently binge watching :)  -- Love the characters, the mystery and the suspense. Reminds me of Law & Order but with way more plot lines.
Great story line, just bad hair for Alicia. Where can I get all of Diane's clothes for an inexpensive price? Wardrobe design is fabulous!

This is a must watch series. Excellent cast of actors and very engaging storyline. If you've made it to season 3, you're already hooked and shouldn't be reading this review! Binge watching at it's best!

This is the way to watch this show if you missed the original run.  Great cast, superb writers, and good story line. I highly recommend it. But, make sure you go back and watch season 1 and 2. You won't be disappointed.

Every evening, I really look forward to the next episodes of The Good Wife.  I'll sure be sorry when the series is over!  The characters are believable, the story is gripping and the actualities are very true to life.  Additional items are that there is extremely little violence, just enough sex to keep things believable and interesting....so it's among my favorites.
My wife and I enjoy it together cheaper than counseling and more enjoyable than fighting we recommend it to all our friends
Great drama series. slight twists throughout. Would recommend watching previous series to develop characters. It will keep you wanting more!
Keeps the steam of intense political drama. I really enjoyed this season. It did not disappoint. Can't wait to get started on season 4.

I really enjoy the story line in this show. All the characters I enjoy watching, although at times character Alicia annoys me sometimes like her mannerisms in the show, the way she talks at times. I am always excited to watch the next episode.
I never got to see the beginning when everyone else was watching.  Now it's my new addiction.  I love the characters, they feel like real people who make real decisions and real mistakes.
Excellent acting. Current themes. Very smart sophisticated show. Sometimes a little hard to follow the action. Highly recommended for adults and older teens.
Good Series with LOTS of surprise guests! Adult oriented content! Good legal practice scheming. NOT for kids, provocative subject matter.
Kept my interest and attention throughout all the episodes.  Dynamic story lines in each one.  Unexpected twists make for excitement.  Fascinating characters.
Great, believable courtroom drama with all the legal twists and turns.  Kalinda, my favorite character, is unbelievably cunning and perceptive.  Raves...
enjoy Good Wife, missed a lot of earlier episodes, time to catch up. Would like to see complete series. Good character development and a very realistic series.
Don't plan on getting anything done for a while if you rent the whole season.  Great cast, writing, pacing, character development, acting.  Love everything about it.
Love this show. Just keeps getting better! Love Alicia and Will. Like the kids, hate Jackie. Still a busy body.
Very well written and very good acting. Always exciting and you never can guess what is coming next. Lots of humor.

Started this series 3 years after it's debut.  I'm glad to be catching up.  My marathon watching is similar to reading a book you can't put down.  This series of lawyers in action reminds me of Perry Mason, only more characters with personalities and cooks in the kitchen.  The acting is believable though sometimes there's a stretch as to how needed information is fortuitously discovered.  I'm glad I decided to start the series from the beginning and, thanks to Amazon Prime, getting value for the yearly subscription.

Excellent cast, acting and writing, This is the best show on tv! Watched all episodes and cannot get over the stories and scripts. Outstanding. 5 Stars with a bullet!!!
For mature audiences.
Somehow I find this show captivating.  Never watched a lawyer show before and I find the stategies intriguing.  The underlying story line is also good.
I really enjoy the show and the quality of picture was terrific. Thank you for bringing it to Prime Instant Video.
i've been a fan of this show since it started. It's not available on any free streaming site so you have to buy it. Totally worth it though.
Like the fact that I can catch up on episodes that I have missed. It helps me understand what's going on when I watch it.
A smart show. Character driven. I feel more committed to the side characters than the female lead, which works here because there are so many good ones.
I loved this season and can't wait to begin the next season. I think this is a great show with all the great things in it.
Watching the first season and seeing Alicia land on top so much after being in the spotlight due to her husbands issues. It was refreshing to see her made more human.
All my friends. The actingi s outstanding and the story lines very good. I hope to see many more episodes of The Good Wife.
Fantastic show. Well written and acted. Story line is intriguing.  Plot never gets dull. Definitely another hit for Julianna M.
This is a well-written television script that allows the viewer to be cognitively stimulated and engaged in the dialogue and plot. It is refreshing and delightful.
Gets better with every season and every episode. I love all the cast. Just wouldn't be the same with them.

It's been a long, long time since I watched anything on one of the regular networks, and, at first, I was put off by how certain elements are conveniently "wrapped up" at the end of each show, but if you allow yourself to ignore that part and enjoy the excellent acting and ever-developing characters, you'll easily lose yourself in this.
I love to watch good/great acting and hear well written scripts.  The stories are interesting and the characters varied and interesting.
I particularly enjoyed watching without the commercial interruptions. The clarity in HD reception was spectacular along with the audio was awesome.
Awesome! Storylines keep getting better and better. Always twists and turns never a dull moment! Can't wait to start the next season
I couldn't stop watching it.  I totally changed my opinion on so many of the characters in this season. great

This is a great  series. I highly recommend it. The only thing is that season 5 won't play please  fix it for me.

Addicting!!

Don not start unless you can watch the whole season and then the next...

Still more interested in the secondary characters than in Alicia and Will. I especially dislike the dance the writers have them do from sleeping together to big we need to stay away from each other to a random out-of-nowhere kiss. I don't sense any chemistry between the actors.
The Good Wife is simply the best legal drama made to date (and I'm an attorney!).  It's 100x smarter than Law & Order and, unlike L&O, is not the least bit formulaic.

love the way it has smart women and deals with news stories happening  at the time.

Great acting and incredible dialog.  The story line builds every week so that I can't wait to watch the next episode.

I generally like shows that are more gritty in nature but I really enjoy this show, well written and great characters.
I love this show- all seasons are amazing! The love story behind the law is truly breathtaking! You'll find yourself begging the tv to kiss her already.
This is the best drama with the. best writing on TV in a long time.  All the actors are marvelous.

I am totally enjoying The Good Wife...it keeps me on the edge of my seat. And the fact that I don't have to watch commercials is wonderful
I'm enjoying the third season of this series and love all the different story lines without losing the main characters.
Just when you think a show doesn't get any better this one does. Loved season 3 and can't wait to watch season 4.

My wife and I discovered "The Good Wife" via a random choice on Amazon Prime's TV show listing.  Not being regular television viewers my wife and I were totally unfamiliar with this program.  We found the good wife to have compelling characters, spiced by complicated, nuanced relationships.  Most intriguing are the legal cases  that the law firm winds their way through in each episode.  The show provides rich insight into the background research and investigation, legal maneuvering and Machiavellian rivalries that shape the eventual outcome of the cases.  Many of the cases involve current socio-political issues which are dealt with in a surprisingly even-handed way,  The show has very high production values which enhance my viewing enjoyment.
Amazing twists and turns - best writing on TV;  interesting that many actors on GoodWife are found on Scandal (another well written show)
The characters are even more interesting and some great plot twists make it a bit more unpredictable for those.  I wish there were more shows like The Good Wife.
The characters have great stories and the acting is superb!  The court cases are ingenious.  I enjoy this drama very much .

Top notch serial  Holds your attention from the very beginning  It's like eating just one potato chip.  You just can't
Stop

still could not be more into this show.  julianna margulies is always great, as is the rest of the cast.

Now that I am on season 5, the current season, I am still able to watch 1 episode after another as I am still catching up.
I must say that this is an excellent show can't get enough of it looking forward to seeing more and more  I hope this never ends

This show is great. I loved every episode and was addicted for a the whole time that I watched all the seasons
Catching up and loving it  If u missed this season it's well worth taking time to catch up.  Excellent show

I knew I had to start at the beginning of the series.  Once I did, I was hooked.  This show is a real grabber, great acting by many unknown to me.  The cast and the directing and the story lines are awesome.
I usually don't watch TV but I am Hooked on this series.  Acting and plots keep me interested. I am glad I have Prime

Not to disappoint - each season seems more interesting with more twists and turns than the previous one.  Finally some background on Kalinda and some new characters keep popping up to keep me interested.  And the court battles are epic and subjects timely - endlessly interesting.

I love the characters, and the writing is great.  the reason it doesn't get five stars is that it's a little too predictable -- they always win, and the info they need to win miraculously appears with little effort on their part.  Also, of course, the time is drastically conflated -- they seem to do in a few days what would probably take years.

Brilliant script & acting.  Addictively suspenseful.  Only discovered it recently, so have watched the episodes from the beginning of the first season to the fourth, & am dreading getting up to date so that there's only one episode a week to watch!

Just love that we found this show. I love watching it on Amazon because no commercials and we watch 2-3 episodes a night!

Just the right mix of continuing plot (Peter and Alicia) with standalone stories. Love watching but I hate the word requirement on these reviews.
Can't quit watching. One of the best TV Series CBS has ever carried.  Ok for all ages to watch. I want more.

Fantastic series - just keeps getting and better - streamed images look like directly off-air. It is an extremely well written and acted show!

This is a riveting show and it is always interesting to see how Alicia pulls off the win! Good job.
this was an excellent episode. Enjoy all the episodes and I especially enjoy the entire series. I feel that it was written well and really keeps my interest.

This is the third season that I have watched and I cannot wait to watch the fourth!  Things keep getting better and more twisted and tangled.  Great performances and guest stars. Gotta watch it.

Top notch and well written. The cast is top notch and always look forward to watching the show. Highly recommend

Great show! I am still watching. Hopefully season 5 is added to prime soon. Great characters and story lines. The end

The writers are doing a very good job of developing the characters, but now getting use to the writing stile I see where the episode becomes a little more contrived, or at the least it is a little easier to anticipate what the reactions will be.  it is like a relationship; it becomes a bit more predictable, but I am still in love and love being in it.  Great show, great writing and great acting.

This is  a great show. Great  story lines. Well written. I really enjoy the HD picture and sound. I am very pleased this interesting show is available on prime. Amazon provides  excellent service in a multitude of ways.

If you haven't seen this show, start it from the first season and catch up! It is definitely one of my favorites.

Excellent story, acting and direction. The characters and plots are gripping. I wish I had a Jalinda to solve all of my problems!!!
love the good wife it makes you want to watch episode after episode. its has intresting cases and super cool character

thoroughly enjoying.all characters are well cast.cant wait to see the next episode. Alicia ,will, eli & kalinda are great.writing is good.

We loved this season. We will be glad when you have season 5 for prime view. We appreciate you so very much.

Love this Show. I have been binge watching for a month. Very interesting story line and characters on this show.

Amazing show!! I love every minute of it, I can not stop watching. I definetly recommend this show to anybody and everybody who loves politics, lawyers, judges, its just great.

Good Story line....I love this show. Alicia is such a great character, I can't wait to get off work so I can come home and watch the next show. I am not going to know what do do when I am finished with all the seasons!!

Great being able to watch all the episodes in order.  I believe I started watching faithfully in the 4th season but will continue to watch all the seasons until the end of the free watch list on Prime.

This show has me captivated with really good writing and character development. I can see why it is called the good wife, because Alicia is always trying to do the right thing when there are so many grey areas.

I hadn't watched any of the shows in the regular season, so thought I would give it a try. It hooked me from the start and now I look forward to seeing how all the players are evolving.  Thank goodness there are the cases which are interesting so it isn't just a soap about the main players.  Their stories and personalities give the show it's edge and all the principal players are very good. It really has me hooked!

The exploration of the ethical and moral dilemmas of the law and of politics (and life, for that matter) and how "doing the right thing" in one setting can come back to bite you in others is well conceived and executed.

The exploration of the effect of science on the law, the acting, the sequencing, the suspense and many other things are great as well.
Great show! Totally worth watching! I am so happy I started watching this show. One of the best on tv!

Consistent balance of great writing, acting and character development.  Continue to enjoy the dramas contained w/in the court room situations as well as the dynamics taking place among the characters!  Ready for season 4!
The series is quite addictive, fun, interesting, with law suits on issues of modern society.  I highly recommend it for its quality.

great show from the start. and keeps getting and better with each season. The 4th season makes the series even better.
Crime,drama,mystery,relationships,wrapped in dry humor,olot twists and surprises,and absolutely amazing acting. Very smart and intelligent. Try this show.you won't stop watching. What a great show.

Very well written and good acting.  The legal issues are interesting (I am a retired Air Force JAG and civilian trial attorney) and the military courts-martial are fairly accurate.

My wife loves this show. It is one she re-watches often. If you like fairly good acting and the pretense of lawyers this is your prime-time soap opera. There is a lot of good looking meat to watch. Your lady will probably love it. Personally I have watched two half episodes. There are way to many actors pretending to be lawyers, doctors, and cops on TV. It all just bores me.

I love this show. Season 3 takes place around 2011, so the plots are timely.  I am rushing to catch up with the current season. I have more seasons to go through. The characters are great and the story lines engaging.
I can't stop indulging in watching Good Wife. I'll ride my stationary bike an extra hour to see another episode.

This is one series that seems to get better as it goes along.  It had been recommended by a friend, but  I didn't find it interesting when I started the series in the middle.  When I found it on Amazon and started watching from the beginning it began to engage me.  It is the perfect thing to watch while on the treadmill -- entertaining, suspenseful, but not too taxing.  Most of the characters have some complexity.  The development of those characters, more than the depiction of solutions of each episode's legal case is what keeps the series moving and encourages me for the next day's treadmill torture.  I don't have experience with the legal profession, but if this is at all accurate, the amorality that underlies it is disturbing.
Witty dialogues, creative plots, character dimensions, suspenseful developments.. This is a all around great law related show with an added bonus--humor!
Ooh just enough drama to keep you on edge! I can't help but think if there is a possibility that things will go back to normal.
Excellent.respect it even more since creators said show is about the education of Alicia Florrick.all seasons are great.very Good tv.
Intelligent show.  Great characters. I can't wait to see what happens and if she remains a good wife.  Would love to see her other side happy.
Love It! Love It! Love It!  Julianna M. is awesome and the character Calinda is  just diabolical enough,with just a touch of humanity.
Great show, as past seasons.  Very intriguing story lines and I really like the continuation of certain court cases and clients.
Is like the legal version of House. Love the show and the characters.  Keeps you in the edge of your seat
I'm catching up with The a Good Wife on Amazon and it's very entertaining.  Thank you, Amazon, for all the programs that can be watched through your instant video app.
