Love this series.  Julianna is amazing.  I usually watch 2-3 at a time. Never thought I'd be a binge watcher.
I really enjoy every episode of The Good Wife, and can't wait to watch the next.  So glad It was recommended as Australia watch for me!
This show shows the politics and craziness of attorneys! !  Love it. Can not stop watching once I started the series.
I like Crime - Investigative - Courtroom - Drama shows and this show really has a good story and characters .. I highly recommend it ... Enjoy :)

I started watching this show somewhere during season 3 so I've been trying to fill in the gaps. So far the show hasn't disappointed.  There is enough going on in each episode to keep the new watcher interested but there is a thread the runs through all the seasons that made me go  back and watch it from the beginning.
The show is so captivating. I can hardly wait for the next episode. The background stories keep you coming back, and the court cases keep you intrigued with the ethical and moral seminars.
Very good stories. Shows you the ins and outs of the law. Seeing how cases can be manipulated to favor the client.  Definitely recommend this show.
Great drama, great story lines, great characters, great location. I love the underlying story as well as the individual cases they work on each episode.
I just love this show!  Watched all 4 seasons on Amazon Prime and one season is just as good any other!
Always intriguing with twists and turns that keep me totally entertained.  I look forward to each new season though am only through the third season.

I started watching it and hated it. However, I wasn't going to post anything about it since it might be somebody else's favorite show. But I keep getting these e mails from Amazon asking for my opinion, so here it is.
Love the legal drama.  Love the character development. The story line keeps me coming back to see what will happen.
I find the characters quite interesting and each case brought to the law firm teaches me a bit more about law.
Good looking folks with sex, high level crime and low level dealings.  Lots of twists in Chicago where they know fancy dealings
Season 3 is still as good as the previous 2 seasons. The characters are still intriguing and great courtroom storylines.
There was absolutely no wrestling.  I don't watch "wife" shows unless there is some wrestling.  Waste of my time - please don't spend any of your saving on this!
We have almost finished the third season. We continue to enjoy the plots and sub-plots. The twists and turns keep the stories ineresting.
Very good series. Julianna Margulies is fabulous! Might be a little slow at times, but overall a good series. I recommend.
My favorite show, Kalinda rocks! The scripts are well written, touches on important themes in contemporary society. Kalinda should have her own show.

Very intriguing. So many plot twists and turns, really keeps you guessing. Acting is superb. All of the major players on the show are complex and interesting. A nice mix of drama and comedy. Can't wait to catch up on all seasons.
Each show is exciting and dramatic. I can watch back to back episodes and never tire of the characters or plot.

We just love this program.  It has everything we enjoy; drama, comedy and a little sex doesn't hurt.  My favorite character is Callenda.  She is a chameleon and can be whoever or whatever the job requires.  Seldom ever loses her cool and goes about her job so quietly you don't even know she's around until she pops up.
Great drama with wonderful plots and terrific cast. I never saw it the first time around but now I'm binge-watching!
The team is phenomenal.  I LOVE the way Alicia litigates.  And Kalinda is the star on top of the tree

I feel like I could practice law after watching this series!  The courtroom drama, behind-the-scenes law firm drama, and political intrigue mix to keep me constantly engaged.  The acting is top rate, and the story line is believable and filled with complex twists and turns.
Fleshed out characters & compelling storyline. When in doubt I pick TGW and never disappointed except in some of the choices the characters make in their lives.
This is One of my favorite series. Great legal drama. Season 3 just as good as seasons 1 and 2 were.

I watched this to get caught up, and now I am glued to this show every week.  This isn't my typical favorite programming.  I usually hate legal drama, but The Good Wife is very different.  They always seem to throw a monkey wrench in sort of like ER used to do.
Love all the characters. The writer's are great. Best show ever. I could watch it every day. Lots of drama, keeps you wanting more. Can't wait for next show.

This series really helps you understand what is rightand wrong with our political and legal system. Clearly there are no black and white answers to many questionsespecially when picking a political party to affiliate with.
Well written show that keeps me pulled in enough to return, but I really wish Alicia's character were a little stronger instead of being so compliant with others' wishes.
Since the first season, episode 1, I have been watching  to catch up on all of them!!! I really enjoy watching this show.

Hands down, this is one of the best written, acted and directed shows available. Hoping Amazon will
add the additional seasons to the lPrime library soon!
Keeps me wondering......what will happen next....great show that continues to roll in the guest stars and this makes a great show even better ....I love it!
Love this show! Alicea always amazes me. Love the cast. Can't wait to see more. Looking forward to season 5.
If you watch season one and two you will not want to stop there because the action continues.  There is love, intrigue, murder, manipulation, and lots of deception.
Omg u have to keep the seasons coming I can't believe how good this show is I thirst for this show when I can't watch it I'm addicted I'm getting close to the last season keep up the good work
I  remained intrigued with the continuous plot line and the twist and turn of the lives of the characters, each episode brings new awareness of the legal system and politics

The plot lines continue to be interesting and unique. Definitely not a predictable series. I like how the individual episodes give you a sense of mystery and completion, while adding to the overall intricacies of the office, legal and personal story lines.
The Good Wife has an excellent story line and keeps you wanting to know what is coming next!  Its based on lawyer and political life in Chicago with a little drama, and action.
Such a good tv show to watch and get into especially if you like lawyer type TV shows. I would recommend the show to everyone

First, I want to say that if your favorite kind of shows are shows about law offices, this probably deserves a 5-star review.  It just so happens that for me, the law holds limited appeal. But - the story lines are intriguing, the personal relationships are very complex, the characters are nuanced - not easy to figure out.  Each episode leaves me wanting more.  There is an element of suspense.  And the main character, Alicia Florrick (played brilliantly by Julianna Margulies) is maturing, growing and evolving over time (as are most of the principal characters.)  Maybe the most fascinating of all is Kalinda (Archie Panjabi, also amazing).  Kalinda plays it so close to the vest that when she shows her hand even a little, it is a revelation. And as an ensemble cast, they all work together beautifully.  Christine Baranski as Diane, the managing partner of the firm, brings so much wit and wry humor to her role.

Oh, what the heck, I just changed my mind.  Give it a 5!

My wife and I have enjoyed this series very much.  We find it entertaining, with good and interesting programs weekly.  It is a refreshing improvement to a lot of the programs with very graphic scenes.
always interesting. My favorite bedtime watching.  The plots are often related to current events. And the characters seem like people I know

Season 3 is very good.  There's less emphasis on the kids and homelife, but more attention given to Alisha and Peter's relationship.  There's a lot more Eli (which is good,) and Alisha and Kalinda have some conflict (which is "mixed.")  Kalinda starts having some problems, and isn't as "invulnerable" as she's been in past seasons.

I'm continuing to watch, and am looking forward to seeing Season 4.

All of the characters are well-drawn and intriguing.  The plots and subplots seem true to life and well developed.  The human ambiguities in all the characters seem so realistic as well as their complex relationships.  Highly recommended.  I think it's important to start with Season 1 if you're a first time viewer--lots of history to enrich the viewing of other seasons.  I am just finishing Season 3 and can't wait to get started with Season 4.
My Husband and I just happened upon this show a month ago. Its the only one we want to watch right now. I love all the actors and characters, and the story line is awesome. And I love Julianne.
I Just Have Really Enjoyed This Entire Season So Far...Actually All Seaasons!!! Has A Lot Going On So You Never Really Know What Is Going To Happen.

My husband and I caught up to where the Good wife is now through 3 seasons.  We were "bereft" when we came to the end!  It is certainly a series that binds you to its various story lines.  Waiting for the next season is very hard!  Enjoy!  Great episodes!

I had never watched this program as it ran on Sunday nights so was delighted to find it on amazon Prime.  It is well-written, fast-paced and riveting.  I am part way through season 3 (with 23 episodes to each season) so it will be a while before I catch up to the network but I love streaming it so I can watch when and where I can.  I think the BEST character is Kalinda, a very young, very talented enigma who is much older than her years.  I never now what's going to happen next!
Love the show. Another great season! I watched it from one end to the other!  Love that I could watch all of the past seasons through Amazon prime.
Season 3 is by far my favorite season. Season 5 is getting there, but from 1-4 this is the best one.

The characters are realistic and likeable. The story lines make sense and I enjoy the occasional added twists. It's The only show I regularly watch and have learned a lot about law and lawyers - an interesting  field I've had no knowledge of. I have recommended this show to several and they share my views. Can't wait to get the 5th season on Prime.
The story lines and writing continue through another year. A very good TV show from the Scott's. I recomend this show.

I downgraded this season from five stars only because of the hanky panky between the good wife and her boss. I know that's supposed to be the conflict that everyone is interested in, but the writing is so good about the law cases that it becomes a distraction. And, I might add, if she were such a good wife, why would she be mixing it up with her boss who is obviously someone who will never make a commitment?

Dear writers, continue with the very interesting law cases, but drop the nonsense between her and Will. She is capable of carrying the show without it.
Great character development continuing. I hope they continue with the current story lines that pull from todays real events and real challenges to the justice system.
Love! Love! Love this show! I seriously think it is one of my favorite TV series. It is a must watch show.
I love the twist of the story. Characters are very intriguing in every episode but the most i love is the family importance,
As with most products of Lefty-wood cant resist injecting politics into the littlest of things. At times it can have excellent court room drama and a nice mystery or two. Surprising good TV drama.

This series is great! I can't wait to own the entire set. Season 3 started off kinda slow but picked up towards the end. This season takes a closer look into some romantic relationships that are brewing.
probably my favorite season so far. Can't get enough Alicia and the rest of the Good Wife cast. Excited for season 4
I love the Good Wife, but I feel season 3 was a little lacking. Still going to watch the rest of the seasons though. I love Cary Argos.
One of the best shows I have ever seen.  Since there are so many reality TV shows on television anymore...it is refreshing to watch a really good tv show with a good story line.

I think the show is awesome due to its writers, actors, producers, and director.  I think the story line is fantastic and easy to keep up with.  I watched one episode and was hooked.  I really enjoy the show and look forward to more episodes.

I think if I was a lawyer then I could understand more what's happening but i don't care. I love lawyer tv shows and this one is no exception. I love that every judge has a personality and that every character has a personality. It is a really fun show and Julianna does a really great job.
I enjoyed the show till she started sleeping with her boss and they ruined it with the women and men having sex. She was no different than her husband a cheat!
Characters are great, each week the drama continues!  Alicia just really needs to dump that husband once and for all...and Jackie, well mothers in law will be mothers in law!
Excellent series! Characters are perfect for their parts. Story lines are always interesting. Even better to watch when it's commercial free
The show has a wonderful cast of characters that draw you in and keep you there. The show keeps getting better each season.
The Good Wife is an extremely well written and well acted TV Series.  I highly recommend anyone who enjoys stories about the law and lawyers to watch it.
The Good Wife is definitely one of my favorite programs; good drama, character development, and enough twists and turns to keep anyone engaged.
I love the funny karma and the over all scheming plot line of the show. It keeps you wondering what will happen next and i'm truly hooked!

It's hard to watch just one episode. We are still intrigued by the intrigue! The characters are so well-drawn, and the Florricks' teenagers have really come into their own in this season. One of the things we love about Alicia's character is the way she takes time to think about her responses, especially in a tight or possibly embarrassing position. And Eli continues to amaze us by his depth. Also by his American accent since he is Scottish (Masterpiece Theater host).

The title "Good Wife" turned me off, and I didn't watch this show for several years. However, I kept hearing how good the show is, so I started with Season One and am now in the middle of Season Three. To my surprise, this is one of the best dramas I've ever seen. The acting is superb, from the major characters to even the smallest of bit parts. The plots are engaging, funny, tragic, thought-provoking. Moral complexities are explored from several angles, and each episode leaves me thinking. I get caught up in this show and time just flies by; it is a great escape from my workaday life!
It wasn't clear and I had problems getting it to work. It could have been better considering that I am paying so much for it.

I like this show quite a bit. The only thing stopping me from rating it with five stars is Will Gardner. I do not understand Alicia's attraction to Will Gardner. He is not handsome, not physically attractive and does not have an attractive personality. Every single time Alicia makes the slightest hint that she is attracted to him, I cringe. When they actually have been physical, I want to puke. He is disgusting. This show would get five stars from me if the role of Will had been cast with someone else. I just don't see anything attractive in this character at all.
Really interesting story lines, although I'm sick of the policital stuff and I hate Kalinda's husband and can't wait until he gets lost.
Good characters, compelling stories, hard to just watch one episode.at a time. The series leaves me wanting to watch one more.
Very addicting. I binged watching this series. I'm a huge fan. Great writing. I love the characters. It is fun watching.

Great characters, well-written and captivating plots!

Season three is even better than one and two. looking forward to 4 and 5

I am offended at all the homosexual scenes , that do not add to the plot. It has gotten so bad that I can't watch it anymore. Peter fools around, so now it's just fine for the "good" wife to fool around too. What a warped sense of values this is sending young people who may be watching.
Character development deepens, relationships change, more explanations for why people are the way they are but still not enough to really know their history.
Excellent show. Great writing, great acting. It's nice to watch intelligent television instead of all of the horrible stuff that is on tv these days.
I watch this series in one weekend.  It leaves you always wanting more.  Great series and recommend it to anyone.
I enjoy this series very much - the plot is intriguing, the character development is interesting and the acting is great!
A very fast moving series...it keeps you guessing.  Very little objective language or suggestive postsures.  I enjoy it very much.

The suspense going up !!!!
More mature show with a lot of plot and suspense to watch. By the way really good show
One of the greatest shows. Always a twist. Intriguing. Juliana Marguiles is an outstanding actress. Worth the prime membership. Has paid for itself.
Always an interesting story line not to mention Alicia is a great lawyer in Will and Dianne's firm. Love the show!
This is such a smart, classy, well done show, and this is the best season yet!  The worst part will be when we are out of videos and have to wait for each season.

Can't say enough about this series! Excellent character development, great acting across the board, even from the youth (Alicia's children).  Loved Season 1 & 2.  A friend told us they didn't think Season 3 was quite as stellar, but I enjoyed the continuation of plot and influx of colorful characters, including Elsbeth Tascioni (Carrie Preston), Louis Canning (Michael J. Fox), Patti Nyholm (Martha Plimpton), among others. Always strong character performances from Diane (Christine Baranskii) and Alicia (Julianna Marquilies), and the sulky/smoldering/explosive Will Gardner (Josh Charles) and Kalinda (Archi Panjabi), along with myriad talent who play off each other so well.  I vote this the best drama on the network!

I've been a fan since the very first episode, but my daughter had never seen The Good Wife until we started watching it together last season.  She became addicted as quickly as I had, so we have been watching all of the previous seasons together.  She loves it, and I'm enjoying each episode all over again.  Both writing and acting are superb.  When we run out of previous episodes, we will be sad that we have to wait for each new episode to come to our TV screen!

The first episode of The Good Wife didn't have sexual scenes, so we thought this would be a clean series to watch.  The story lines revolving around legal issues were interesting.  As the seasons progressed, the episodes began showing sexual scenes that are totally unnecessary.  Very disappointing they felt it necessary to incorporate such perverseness in a series that was interesting without such scenes!
Fabulous cast, acting is great, story lines are pretty good, although can stray from real legal ethics.  A top pick for my whole family.

I am not usually a fan of lawyer shows but this one was very intriguing. The premise is different and I love that they use mature but attractive women instead of just the young ones. I am on season 4 and I have yet to be bored...That is the highest complement I can give.

I always look forward to my special time watching this series.  The main character, Alicia, is smart, caring, and is wonderfully portrayed.  The supporting characters are all very dynamic and each have their own entertaining aspect.  The female actors in this series are the best I have seen I. A series.  Enjoy!

The positive attributes of this series are the very convoluted plots and skilled actors. I give them A's for both. Believable roles played by actors with the talent to fit.  Excellent casting.  I can't emphasize enough.

There are several plots and subplots. What I like most is the satisfactory resolution of each story line in each episode;
compounded by back stories on each of the characters which is ongoing and continues to develop.
No character leads a perfect life. Although completely believable, are not like anyone I would know personally. Sometimes I am amused or disgusted by their foibles and other times, I sympathize. In short, there are plenty of twists and turns to contemplate, lots of complexity in the plots.

 I am a little curious about "Will Gardner"....he looks tired, with dark circles around his eyes. Is this intended to show him in ill health? Is that makeup or are we experiencing foreshadowing?

 I'm not so sure I would ever vote for Mr. Frollic....he needs to be made more loveable, so far is is half Rat.

Eli Gold...love him...his body language fits the complexity of his role...his x-wife, however, doesn't fit. Great casting here.

Calinda...interesting role...not so sure her "secrets" are that important in this age.  The actress does a good job playing that part, however. Her wardrobe is completely unprofessional for a law office. But I suppose she does most of her work in the street.
She needs to have some changes of wardrobe to fit in with the variety of places she must go to investigate. An undercover agent would probably do that.

The good wife...her role, so far, hasn't been about being a wife, thank goodness. Running around in high heels all the time isn't to realistic...she needs to dress in tennis shoes then change to heels, much more believable in the big city.

Cary...so cute, he deserves more complexity, perhaps it will develop in his role over time.

Lockhart...powerful role, done really well. She may be headed for a nervous breakdown??

Who is my favorite character?  Calinda, I think. Always wondering what the firm will give her to investigate...much more important than her private life.
Maddy...another political Rat.
The Mothers-in-Law....well, can't you just strangle them. No advice here. Their roles so far just irritate and provide pause before the main plots.  Perhaps they "need a lawyer" now and then as their high jinks could be made amazing.

Although the characters look professional in clothing, etc. as indicative of a professional law firm, there is no overblown fluff about designer clothing, labels or false glamour. It's all about the plot(s).  Thank you, some aspects like costume design need to be in background....by the way, the costume designer is doing a great job.
Some nights I watch 2 or 3 episodes on Amazon Prime and am never bored.  Excellent guest performances provide relief from too much inbreeding.
Michael J. Fox is outstanding and I'm so pleased to see him back in his game. He has been missed on TV.
All in all....one of the best series on TV!  Please keep it free on Amazon Prime so I can continue to be a fan.
One of my top three favorite TV shows this year.  Good stories and characters. Don't appreciate Amazon pushes for more words in the feedback.
Like overall theme. Getting a Little too much sub plotting for my taste. But have  enjoyed the series immensely. Thanks
great story lines, not too much drama, but I notice all British people are named "Nick".  As a wannabe British person, I'd like to say that I don' think that's true.
A very cut throat show with lots of twist and turns.  All the actors were believable. It's a good show.
Season 3 was as good as I expected after watching 1&2. All great!!  I didn't start watching on tv til season 4 so I enjoyed catching up.
EACH SEASON GETS BETTER.  RUSHING TO GET THROUGH THEM ALL BUT LOVING EVERY MINUTE.  THE MIX OF JUDGE CHARACTERS IS QUITE ENTERTAINING.
the characters are so awesome- I cannot get enough of this show. So glad it is available on Amazon Prime!!

If I could give this show a better review, I would, but you only have 5 stars. The characters are terrific. Even though there is a continuing timeline, there is a case that begins and ends with each show. Love that!! Julianna Marguiles is wonderful in her part. Chris Noth I have followed for years. He is so great!! Perfect for his part. Josh Turner is also, a terrific bad boy. Christine Baranski just gets better with time. You couldn't ask for a better cast of characters. Anyone who isn't watching is losing out!!!
Love the series - ordering all seasons.  I'd recc. this to all my friends.  Can't wait to watch the rest of the seasons.
This is a well-thought-out drama.  Pays attention to detail.  Sometimes borders on the absurd.  Believable legal issues utilizing "good" law.

THE SHOW IS VERY WELL PUT TOGETHER .YOU CAN TELL EVERYONE HAS WORKED VERY HARD TO MAKE IT WHAT IT IS AND THAT IS GREAT! NEVER A DULL MOMENT.I HOPE IT CONTINUES FOR MANY YEARS TO COME. HATS OFF TO THE WRITERS ,ACTORS,ACTRESS
The Good Wife is my new addiction and each season gets better. The wriiting is brilliant and the characters are wonderful!

We have moved onto watching Season 4 of the Good Wife. We look forward to watching the Good Wife each week and cannot wait to watch again this year. Keep up the excellent story lines and dialogue. We are hooked!
Awesome show. I love Prime streaming. After my free trial is over I will be purchasing Amazon Prime. I love this show.

The authors keep the viewer involved, anticipating the next "soap-opera" incident.  the cast of characters is first-class, very believable.  The viewer just doesn't want anything bad to happen to their favorite characters, but life always does.  The plots vary, always informing.  The clothes are so chic.  I'd watch this series again.
Sooooo good. I am loving this show. Never a dull moment. Started season 4last night. I'm going to be very sad when it's over.
Interesting characters, terrific acting!  Drama, suspense, humor- one of my favorite shows ever!  Gets better with each new season.  Watch it!

Love,love, love this show.... I look forward to it every night. It has become my husband's and my  favorite
.
I'm hooked I love this show and love watching it on amazon prime. season 1-4 are great so far.  It's my escape TV show

Good series, excellent actors.  In addition to being entertaining it is quite informative.  I just wish u had more time to watch it everyday.  So please don't take it off prime until I have time it catch up to current season.
I love Kalinda, and adore Alicia. The best show in the TV with best actors and good writers. I really liket.
I love this show. I don't think I've seen a bad episode. It is consistently good and worth watching. I certainly recommend it.
Great show! Very unpredictable and a good pace. Characters are engaging.  This is the third season and the characters continue to develop.
This show is smart, sexy and well written.  The cast is flawless. The guest stars are simply incredible! I can't get enough of this show!!
I'm late in watching this series and got started after it was highly recommended by friends - now I'm hooked, too! Great drama and well acted.
Intelligent & intriguing for a adult audience. Great character interaction & tension. Always amazed at how well dressed main characters are!
I really like the story line and the cast. The various lawyers get into some difficult situations and somehow are able to survive. Lots of humorous characters.
Love it!!  Great program and great stars.  You learn a lot about the law and how it works.  Thank you.
What is not to love? Mysteries, crime , politics, complicated relationships, strong characters. Yup, this show has it all. Warning: highly addicting
Keeps me wanting more as I continue to watch all of the episodes from the beginning. Can't Stop and highly addictive!
It continues to develop the characters so you know who they are even more.  Good story lines and I love how they bring in well known actors and have reoccurring roles.
Really got into this show. One episode to another and before I know I'm done with the season in a few nights
We truly enjoy binge watching this show on the weekends. It is a very good series with great acting. We are hooked.
Great show, great writing.  I love the cast.  A little suspense, a little love, a lot of drama.  Perfect weeknight watching.

This is such a well done program, the ensemble cast is outstanding. The reoccurring characters lend a reality to this series that I truly enjoy.

My favorite character is Kalinda,  that girl truly has it going on!!!

Anyway, I Iove this series, if you are looking for engrossing entertainment that makes you think The Good Wife is the series for you. Enjoy.
I really enjoy this season too. I really like how this show doesn't dwell on showing sex for ratings, instead they leave sex to your imagination and I like that better.

Although the constant posturing and political side of the law firm is really tiresome, the story lines remain cerebral and well-written. Characters are believable although I wonder if I can stand to heard "Do you have a minute?" one more time (doesn't anybody work at that firm?)  The people would just up and die without a cell phone attached to their face. I enjoy Alicia's interaction with her children and cheered when she finally stood up to her mother-in-law. Will keep watching!
The content is a refreshing, captivating and well written. The Good Wife has a new fan! Law and Order move over
This show has us addicted! So much for our membership to Netflix. It looks like we'll be putting that on hold until we've caught up with The Good Wife.
good court seines and good acting. My sister got me into it and now I am hooked. going back to see all the seasons
I've been binge watching this series, starting back at the beginning.  Am enjoying it just as much if not more the second time around.  Recommend highly.
The Good Wife is a great show! Action packed, lots of drama, betrayal, and suspense. Once I start watching I can't move from the T.V.

Didn't think I was going to enjoy the show but I was wrong A good show wish I had watch from the beginning will have to wait to see this year shows as I started to late to watch and not know what was going on.
my girlfriend got me in to this show some time ago. i have not been able to put it down, amazing
Great, interesting and informative. There could be a bit less romance drama that would make it more interesting. Overall good

The story line keeps expanding, remains intriguing and keeps pleasantly surprising. I remain an ever faithful audience. I never can anticipate what's coming - and I like that. Acting is excellent in this series!!
I like lawyer/court room dramas, so decided to watch this series. I was not disappointed. All the player's are perfect plus the story holds my internet.

I love TV series that take the time for characters to develop week after week. Like the peeling of an onion, layers of intricacy unfold as the writers masterfully reveal characters' strengths and flaws, creating an almost hypnotic pull for the viewer to see the next episode. I find that the development of Zack and Grace has been remarkable. Storylines are well-thought out, compelling and, most importantly, believable. The actors are outstanding, using subtlety and nuance to convey what words alone sometimes cannot. This is must-see TV.

Oh, okay, maybe I should give the season 5 stars -- after all, I do still love "The Good Wife." However, there's a lot going on this season that I find annoying. First off, Millennials should be offended by how they're being portrayed on this show. It seems that all the new characters are 20- or 30-something, and they're all 1) preposterously gorgeous with perfect bodies; 2) glib, jaded, snarky and humorless (especially if they work for the State Attorney's Office).They also treat sex like something you do when you're bored. Where's the heart in these characters? And if Cary Agos doesn't wipe that squinting-eyed smirk off his face I'm going to slap him with a lawsuit for intentional inflection of emotional distress.

Also: Why is the whole world against Alicia Florrick? Currently:  Her ex mother-in-law is snooping through her apartment, trying to get the goods on her; her former colleague (via her ex-husband) is trying to find a way to bring down her entire law firm in general and her boss-boyfriend in particular; and a new, young, blonde associate (didn't she used to date Don Draper?) is leaving drool-spots all over Lockhart Gardner's expensive Berber carpets as she schemes to swipe Will away from Alicia before the next commercial break. Not only that, but Diane Lockhart is staring at her creepily through the glass walls because she suspects that Alicia and Will are violating the firm's sexual harassment policy. And oh yes, her best friend slept with her husband. And her kids are giving her the Third Degree about how she spends her time when they're at their dad's, as if she's not allowed to date. I'm starting to worry for Our Heroine. Can't the writers bring in Lisa Kudrow to play Alicia Florrick's therapist? I really think she needs one at this point.

Trying as all this is on my nervous system, there's still much gold to be mined this season: seeing big stars in small roles (not quite cameos, but almost) has always been part of TGW's fun, and so far we've had Harvey Fierstein, Parker Posey and Bob freaking Balaban! I'm waiting to tune in one day and see Richard Dreyfuss as a sitting judge. Wouldn't he be perfect in black robes?

I've been hooked since Season 1 after ignoring all my friend's pleas to watch it.
Julianna, Archie, Christine and the entire cast keep you watching.
I'm now onto Season 4.
Must watch, or rather, must binge watch television.
This is a first rate series. The acting is good, the stories intriguing, the chemistry between characters superb. It's well worth watching.
Excellent acting, writing - pacing seems a little slower than season 2.  Also, too many story lines and too many characters.

Not just Season 3, rather Seasons 1 - 4:  Julianna Margulies delivers every episode with precision!!! Her character development is beautifully unraveling; and like James Spader, in Boston Legal, breathes a level of quality, sophistication, belief, and entertainment into her character which solicits a roller-coaster of emotions invoked by great episodic performances, subject matters, and predictable/unpredictable/ though-provoking resolutions.  In addition, The Good Wife has an absolutely amazing cast that performs equally as stellar.  Eagerly awaiting the air of Season 5.

I am a 72 year old male, who after 46 years of marriage thought his wife and daughter had sensitized him to "women's issues."  However, after watching the first four seasons of The Good Wife, I learned so many shades of "women's issues," I became addicted to the shows and learned a lot.
Good show to watch because all the action and drama. Love it. Finally a female main character that isn't just used for sex.
It's a great show with well-developed characters, a driven plot and witty, complex ethical court cases. Whole series is fun!
More like 3.5. Not quite as good as the first time. The "wife" sometimes makes overly emotional decisions which seem to be more for dramatic effect, and actual just make her annoying.
Was just in awe! of the first 2 season, but the 3rd season takes it to another level.  I think I am falling in love with the "Good Wife" series!
This show really keeps you wanting to watch it. I love the actors and the writers, they seem to write about todays actions. LOVE IT!

I never watched The Good Wife until recently and now I'm binge watching!  Love it!  It's not only beautifully written with really clever plots but the production quality is great!  Beautiful sets and costumes and people!  Fun to watch!
Fantastic!  One of the best series I've seen in a long time--and I've seen a lot of great television in the past several years.
Started watching the show 6 weeks ago, and will be finished with the third season in a day or so, It is an intelligent show focused on how the legal system looks from the defendants side.
I enjoy all of the characters and I think the writing is excellent. my favorite character is Belinda. hopefully she gets back with her husband.

Julianna Margulies plays a stunningly strong, determined, intelligent and rational character in this show - The Good Wife is a perfect name for the show, and her character.  She deals with things on a daily basis that would cripple many. She has her faults, but the writers are able to show her imperfections as, well, human imperfections.  Phenomenal actress, phenomenal writing.  REALLY.  I'm out of adjectives for this show...

I wrote a fairly comprehensive review for season one, and the same review applies here. It is an extremely well-done show, in every aspect, that I cannot recommend highly enough.  WATCH IT.
ESPECIALLY since it is free with Amazon "Prime", another great product.
I like the show. It makes me want to watch all the shows in one sitting. If you haven't seen the shows, I highly recommend them. Thank you.

I like the continuity of the lives of key characters, the Florrick family, the  the law firm, the states attorney office, and the several political campaigns.  I like the candid look at Chicago politics and the judicial branch and Diane Lockhart's idealism at war with realities of competing in business.  I like the savvy inclusion of technology used by Kalinda and the part social media plays in modern life.  I enjoy the returning guest characters (the ones you love to hate).  Love the portrayals  of modern teenagers.

As the seasons come and go this show has become a more regular part of our viewing habits.  The quality of the scripts shows continuous improvement.  The show has well known cast members and regular appearances of popular actors/actresses.  Once on has watch a few of the shows it is easy to become "hooked".  Watching the show sans commercials on Amazon Prime means we watch more than one episode at a session.  We've little to find worthy of spending our time watching on TV, this show is an exception.
The good wife is a classic case of great writing perfect casting and the kind of stories that are engaging.  Dont miss it.
This was great drama. The twist and turns kept your interest for the next episode. By this season three, the propaganda politics was phasing out. That was a great move.
This series gets better every season. I wouldn't miss it. I'm sorry I waited so long to watch it. The best!
I can watch this series over and over and it is good to have entertainment that we watch as a couple.

great acting and story line.....this show demonstrates how lawyers, no matter what side of the courtroom they place their brief case, endeavor to manipulate and tweak the law for their clients with the sole intent being, to bring home a humongous slab of bacon.
Love the cases.  The fact that they don't win them all.  That Alicia is human in so many ways but so very strong.  Just a feel good series with a bit of edge of your seat drama.
Another GREAT season!!! This show just keeps getting better!! Come on Prime, get Season 5 out there before I finish Season 4 :)

Very we'll written and excellent performances. An intelligent show that keeps you on your toes.
Perhaps the best season yet!
excellent shows - want to see the next one to be able to keep up with twists and turns -

This show is consistently excellent.  The plot lines are engaging, the characters developed and intriguing and the momentum stays strong.  Eli Gold was misused in the whole partner debacle, so I'm glad to see him on the campaign trail again.  Love this show!!

I like that each episode is new, fresh and interesting...lots of sub plots to
make you stay interested...  They use recent news, alternative sex, dirty
lawyers and politicians..great acting.

This is a very good tv show. Great cast, great stories. Watch one show and you'll be hooked. Many side stories, not sure exactly what's going to happen next with the cast of characters. Excellent casting.
More drama per square inch. The tangled web we live. It only brings home how complicated life can be. An inside look at the wheelings and dealings involved in legal life. Money makes the difference.
I really enjoy watching shows like this thanks to my Amazon Prime account. I'm looking forward to seeing more of my favorite shows here.
This show is the closest show to different aspects of the law in the court room. Studying to be a paralegal and love this show!
Such a great show.  It gets better and better.  Definitely a show to keep watching.  You want to know the law, well watch this show.
I like this show very much. Sometimes the court case were very intense. It looks like a real court TV Chanel. I really enjoy to watch their performance very well.
Great story of someone who deals with whatever life brings her and tries to make the right decisions for her and her family.

What I didn't like was the political statements David E Kelly always interjects..... thus the reason for only 4 stars.  When I am watching TV for entertainment I don't appreciate the controversy of politics when it is not needed.
The drama and conflict keep you pressing the next 'Watch Now' button.  Like  potato chips, you cannot have just one.
still very involved with the drama of the complex characters  can't alway s keep my feeling straight with to whom I am rooting for
Alicia's life gets more interesting, as does Calenda's. The cases are always interesting, although you pretty much know who's going to win. This is the most addictive TV series I know.

Good wife season 3, it was classy, intellectual,and funny.

My husband and I watched the episodes from the beginning and sometimes we stay up until wee hours of the morning because we want to know what happens in the next episode.  It is really a very good show.

Prime doesn't cover season 5.  We needed to overlook some content and almost stopped watching it, but it did turn around.  The story line carried throughout.

I missed this series when it first came out but heard so many good things about it that when it started over again on syndication I tuned into it and became hooked, hooked and hooked. It is smart, well written and well acted. IT is not black and white - meaning, the characters are more rounded, the bad can be good and the good can slip. There are smart stories. And a touch of romance, yum.. (and I am not routing for the expected)

The Good Wife is a great show,  but i find the streaming from Amazon to be ssssslllllooooowwwww.  So slow that it hampers the enjoyment of the product.  I frequently need to uninstall and reinstall the amazon app onto my tv for it to stream at all.
The quality if the picture has gotten better as the series has moved along.  Frequently the sound does not match the mouths of the characters.

This is a very good show that keeps you wanting to see more.  As any show, it has lots of unrealistic things (i.e. Kalinda's talent...very tough in high hills and leather skirts who can resolve the most difficult enigma in a couple of hours and fight the toughest guy, win and not even have a scratch), but the plot and performance are brilliant! Can't wait until 9 March for the new episode!!!
It is a good series and the acting of all the characters are outstanding..  Would love to watch Season 5

It is always has interesting plots and situations that are usually resolved by the end of the episode. I look,forward tp each issue

There are no real good guys, just human beings.

Great fun.
Great writers, actors & a great show. Storylines really get you into it, Cary and Alicia are the best characters.
strong writing and character development; at times a bit like a soap opera, but the writers seem to be working on giving more dimension to the characters.
I can just say that the show is very entertaining and gets addictive once you start watching.  Just watch the first episode.

This show is well written and the cast is amazing!!! Hope to be in a future show as an extra!!!

Although we do not share the 'sleep around' and 'gay' views expounded by this program, we think the writers and directors present those views tastefully and the show's good attributes, story lines and vast coverage of real time 'legal' issues more than offset those 'off-color' views.  We would recommend this program to any adult interested in great acting and legal proceedings.
The writers some up with some good stories that vary quite a bit.  It stays very interesting.  I think it is worth watching.
Love it! The good wife just keeps getting better and better. Bring on season 4 and 5! Xo xo xo

This is GREAT TV. The writing is superb. I fine the stories interesting and I enjoy the story line. I'm recovering from surgery and am restricted as to what I can do...having good TV to watch is a great way to fill the hours of my days. I'm so glad the Good Wife is there to watch!

One of the best shows on television. Always on the edge of my seat. Alicia is so relatable. Great show.
I enjoy watching the full series episode by episode by episode as the plots unfold and no commercials best way to view
Each episode leaves you waiting with anticipation for the next.  With multiple storylines and surprising guest stars, you can never predict where the story will go.  So don't miss an episode!
I really love the show. Wish I had been watching since the beginning. Now i'm trying catch up to this season.

Love the drama and her steely determination to do right. I am saddened by the negative portrayal of religion, especially Christianity, and the unharnessed sexuality. It's not necessary to the success of the story.

Excellent progression of the story line. I like Diane being a strong woman. Plus I like her working relationship with Will. Will has respected Alicia's choice of supporting her husband even though they live apart. Will has tried to put his feeling to the side. I love Kalinda. Another strong woman. She doesn't put up with any crap from anyone but still uses her God given gift. She is smart and cares about people. The writing on this show is fantastic.

WE have been marathon watching this series for a few weeks now, starting from the beginning.  It is exceptionally well written and produced.  If you like "lawyer shows", like "Suits", "Boston Legal", "LA Law", "Ally KcBeal", I guarantee you will consider "The Good Wife" the best of the genre so far!

Im really surprised how much I love this show. I can't wait to watch the next season. I recommend watching this show ASAP

A good watch for the long winter weekends

My wife started watching this show so I joined in ... Pretty freaking great show! A lot of dynamic characters, you're sure to fall in love with one of them! They also do a great job of keeping a story going, while there may be a few that drag overall amazing!

Great show-much better than "reality tv." Can't wait to watch each episode! I hope they never retire this fantastic show!!

, and the interaction of the characters are clearly delineated.

I'm glad I became an Amazon Prime member, so I can watch all 6 seasons for FREE! Well, I paid for it, but great benefits with the shipping and the all you can watch television and movies!
Loved Season 3.  Can't wait to start Season 4.  Awesome show, didn't know what I've been missing all these years.
Each episode is good and could easily stand alone. I like that they weave characters in and out of the plotline.

A truly excellent show with superb actors.  I first started watching when The Good Wife first aired but fell out of watching.  I recently  have watched again from the beginning:  Season 1 and am now on season 4.  I love the guest appearances by well known actors.  The plots always keep you guessing.  Every episode is masterfully executed.

The Good Wife is my guilty pleasure..  Cant' wait to watch more.
This season is getting interesting but towards the end, it starts stalling. But I am gonna still watch the 4th and the 5th season

Much better than originally assumed! Great "law" show!! We are now addicted!

I have watched all the seasons in a row on Amazon Prime and have really loved them.  Never let's you down

This show has steady plot progression and solid character development. Some of the characters are uncommon and more true to life than most TV shows ever portray. Alicia and Kalinda can both be mysteries at times.

One downside is that the interesting characters are nearly all women and the men in the show (except perhaps Canning and Eli) are quite bland.
Imaginative, clever, engaging, interesting...first rate acting; first rate scrips; excellent production values. Overall, a winning combination of social & moral issues that are well told.
Thoroughly entertaining. The secondary characters really make the show. Cary and Kelinda are my absolute favorites. I'm well into the fourth season now and will be watching the fifth as well.

It is amazing how this series keep up the interest and suspense by constantly bringing up new events and characters. Anyone interested in the law should regard these episodes as real depictions of what goes on in big law firms and the lawsuits that they have to deal with. I would not miss it. It is truly a great series and will continue to be.  John T. D'Alessandro Philadelphia

Everything has ramped up in the Good Wife during this season. The depth of character development, the skill at interesting segues into the past -- these are just a couple of things that create a kind of complex layering that is fascinating on many levels. It is no longer linear storytelling. I don't know if new writers came on board, or what. An example would be the story line in which Alicia has a chance to buy the house where she was a full time Mom before Peter's scandal came down. Her visit is poetry, and charged with images of objects in the house and yard that become powerful metaphors for her losses. (I won't give away these shots, but the one involving the bathroom wall is especially poignant.) I am hooked on a series that I only mildly enjoyed up till now.

I am really enjoying all the seasons offered by Amazon "Prime."  Worked in a law office for several years (5 years-plaintiff/10 years-defense). Very good depiction of the workings inside a law office. Script is excellent and actors are great. I missed the series when it first broadcast. Glad that Amazon is offering this selection; I am going to follow the new season. I am a fan!
I saw a part of this on Hallmark and mentioned it to my husband. He started watching it and couldn't stop. He said it was extremely well-written.
The intensity of the The Good Wife characters are more defined.  Funny, many turns and twists and unexpected endings.  I thoroughly enjoy this series.
Finally, found a show that is fun to watch and doesn't have all the language that other shows have -  It is easy to get caught up in the characters in this show!
Great acting, relevant plots.  Lots of scheming by the partners.  A little more realistic than Boston Legal.  One of the few decent choices on tv.
Full of drama. Its a bit like sherlock holmes with the lawyers.  I think kalinda is the reason why their law firm is so good.
I love The Good Wife. The acting is superb as are the story lines. Alicia Florrick's role of wife, mother and new working attorney is truly exciting to watch.
It's ok. Kinda repetitive but love the cast and that they are in Illinois ! It's a very good show

Then you will love The Good Wife.  Each episode has great cameo's by famous character actors as judges.  Some of my favorite judges are Dennis O'Hare, Ana Gasteyer, Uncle Jr (for you Soprano fans), and Harvey Fierstein.  The writing is great and keeps you always thinking one way, and the plot shifts the other.

As for Julianna Margulies, she has a pair.  Her character grows from a meek and tormented SAHM (Stay at Home Mom) to a wonderfully intelligent lawyer who knows exactly where she wants her new life to take her.  Challenges come and go, but she is powerful enough to stay true to her beliefs and family values.  Kudos to the writers because sometimes women forget the family part when power comes so easily.
each episode I get more involved with the characters and the stories I love Kalinda and Carrie and the excitement they bring to the show
This show is so good. I can't believe I never watched it but you can only dvr just so many shows. Now it's on my favorite list

I love this show. I'm slightly a nerd when it comes to the law (I'm in law school), but my friends who are not at all into law love the show too. It just has great characters and some good entertainment.
The characters are silly stereotypes but well drawn and interesting.  West wing style directing around the law firm.  All-in-all, a fun series.
My wife especially enjoyed watching it as a binge series during this year's cold winter.  She's looking forward to the next season.
We watch two episodes a night.  Tonight we get to the last of season three then It's on to season four.  We love the characters and the plots!
Brilliantly written, great acting with varied and excellent guest performances, wonderfully paced and structured. A very definite five stars. Go ahead watch it, you will not be sorry.
I have watched this show from the beginning and am amazed at how well the writing has held up. Now I am going back and watching them again from the start and am enjoying them all over again.
Because I like it wish season 5 was free on Amazon.com please make free for those that don't Get a chance to watch on regular television

The Good Wife continues to be a well acted, well directed drama.  It has an excellent cast, with occasional cameos by well known actors and political figures.  The scripts are excellently written.  We just finished Season 3, and I'm anxious to start Season 4. This series is free to Amazon Prime users.
I love all the different actors/actresses, old and new, that grace this show and then poof they are gone.  It's like a surprise attack. That Calinda with a wicked right hook... Get a new husband. ;-/

I have not finished watching this season but I love the characters and there is a truth to it all

love Kalinda and Eli---good show. Hard to write as many words as you require to post a rating, but it's a 4.
Good character development and interesting plot. We really got drawn in and we will definitely finish all of the series.
Fun to watch.  Each episode had an interesting case to solve intertwined with the drama of the lives of the attorneys.

Love this show. They perhaps overdo it with Julianna Margulies' character being constantly 'right' and flawless, but the overall cast is brilliant, the writing a nice balance between long story arcs and episode-level procedurals.

Archie Panjabi deserves the praise she gets. A unique balance of humor, mystery, sexiness and solid acting. Chris Noth is exactly Chris Noth, Alan Cummings nails it repeatedly, though there is a disconnect between his being a high-powered, feared political operative and an absolute pushover in every scene.

Christine Baranski wasn't a favorite of mine in the past but shows the most depth and nuance of any of the cast.

Overall great, and season 3 is better than season 2.
This is a great show. I'm enjoying the character development with each progressing season. The cases they handle are also pretty interesting.

Once again the complex characters return. Colinda's husband shows up, Peter runs for governor, and the bankruptcy of Lockhart & Gardner provide many interesting and entertaining situations. Alicia is still her cool, smart, sexy self.
Excellent acting, excellent cinematography, excellent scripting, good to excellent direction. What's not to like? Pretty good story, too. I recommend The Good Wife.

There is also some great comic relief. I stream this during my toddler's naptime, if I am able to take a break. For me its the ultimate break from "kid world" - I love it!

Love the show. Love the characters. Good cast. Every single episode is good. like the law aspect of the show. i also like how their lives are more on display that in other series.

an engrossing series - will definitely get you stuck in the relationships, and the legal cases are extremely interesting to follow - somehow the writers can rapidly add cases that pull from the real world.
